title: How do you vote in Strictly Come Dancing?
text:
Together with partner Giovanni Pernice, Michelle Visage was one of the contestants who glided through another round of Strictly last week (Picture: BBC / Guy Levy)

Strictly Come Dancing is back on BBC One tonight with more sequins and sashaying in the fifth week of the debonair dance show.

The likes of former Coronation Street star Catherine Tyldesley and football icon Alex Scott are hoping to make it through another week of primetime television tension, but their fate is ultimately down to the public and the judging panel.

Want to know how you can have your say this time? Read on to find out how to cast your vote…

How to vote in Strictly Come Dancing 2019

Hosts Claudia Winkleman and Tess Daly open the voting on screen each week by sharing a long landline number that viewers can call to back their favourites.

After every act has strutted their stuff on the floor, fans can dial the number to impact the outcome.

Advertisement

Advertisement

A shorter number applies to votes made by text on mobiles, and the basic charge for calls and texts from landlines and mobiles is 15p – although network charges may apply.

Former England goalkeer David James will be aiming to provide a safe pair of hands for dance partner Nadiya Bychkova (picture: Ray Burmiston/BBC/PA Wire)

Can I vote in Strictly Come Dancing online?

As well as voting by phone, you can visit bbc.co.uk/strictly to get involved and pick your winners for the week.

Just like voting by phone, you’ll need to wait until voting is announced as open to do this.

Following the vote, the departing contestants will be announced on Sunday. Whichever way you vote, don’t forget to read the full terms and conditions on the BBC website.

Strictly will be on tonight from 6:40pm on BBC One.

description: Want to know how you can have your say on who makes it through Strictly this week? Read on to find out how to cast your vote…
